metadata.title: The Fall's Gonna Kill You
metadata.time_reference: During the events around President Bartlet's health issues

releases.details: The West Wing: The Complete Second Season

notes: This episode focuses heavily on the challenges faced by the administration regarding President Bartlet's health.
The subplot with Josh feeling pressured by tobacco companies highlights ongoing political battles.

in_universe_mythology: Continuation of the Bartlet Administration's challenges
real_world_cultural_references: References to tobacco litigation and Congressional budget analysis

continuity_notes: This episode follows the ongoing narrative of President Bartlet's health and its impact on his administration.
Early indications in the series foreshadow the later developments in the storyline regarding health issues.

plot.plot_summary: C.J. meets with Oliver Babish, who questions her about her honesty regarding the President's health. Meanwhile, as Sam works on a speech, the team tries to address a falling satellite hoax and concerns about lower budget projections that could affect the administration. The subplot revolves around the tobacco litigation, highlighting the challenges faced by Josh in securing funding and the essence of the polls required to measure public reaction.
